description: Absolute value of determinant of n X n matrix whose entries are the integers from 1 to n^2 spiraling inward, starting in a corner.
comments: Starting in the NW or SE corner, the signs are cyclic (+,-,-,+), starting in the NE or SW corner, the signs are always positive.
references: Problem 1517 in the Feb. 1997 issue of Mathematics Magazine.
links: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..200
maple: a:= proc(n) option remember; `if`(n<2, (3*n+1)/4,      4*(3*n-1)*(2*n-5)*(2*n-3) *a(n-2) /(3*n-7))    end:seq(a(n), n=1..20);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Jan 21 2014
